name: Amsterdam's Jewish Quarter and World War II (Available in )
description:
* It is a live tour so it will start at 4:30 p.m. (local Spanish and Dutch time) *
On this virtual walk through the old Jewish quarter of Amsterdam , I invite you to discover some of the most historic corners of the city. From the great synagogues that the first Jews to arrive in the city built in the 17th century to the Auschwitz Monument , located in the oldest park in the city, I take you on a journey back in time to the Amsterdam of the Second World War . Together, we will learn not only the history of the Dutch Jewish community, but also the Dutch resistance struggle against Nazi barbarism.

All this while we stroll through some of the most charming canals and streets of Amsterdam. Are you coming?

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour Red Light District, a neighborhood that leaves no one indifferent (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
👉 - For two years it has been forbidden that tours go through the windows of the Red Light District where sex workers are. The tour borders them and shares a map to walk each and every one of the things that are explained.

Do you dare to know the most controversial neighborhood in Europe? Do you want to know the reality of prostitution in the Netherlands? In this Free Tour we will learn about the history of the Red Light District in Amsterdam, how it works, what it offers, if legalization implies full normalization or not, which shows are the best known and much more. Enter the red light with all the information you need , in a respectful and relaxed atmosphere . There are no unanswered questions on this tour.
During the walk we will visit the borders of the Red Light District and I will provide you with all the necessary information so that you can visit it knowing what you have in front of you.

Some of the topics we will talk about are:

  • Historical tour about the relationship between the city and prostitution.
  • La Condomerie , the world's first specialized condom store
  • How windows work: standards, prices, health and safety implications
  • The gay area of the Red Light District
  • The daycare that is located in the heart of the district. An example of coexistence
  • Main monuments
  • The spiciest shows
  • Most impressive clubs
  • The reality of legalized prostitution: trafficking, taxes, mafias and individual work decisions


The Red Light District is an experience that leaves no one indifferent and, therefore, it is absolutely essential. If you are interested in knowing this reality and forming your own opinion, do not hesitate to come with me on this tour. I guarantee you have a great time and learn together about a way to face the reality of prostitution that does not exist in our countries. I wait for you!

* The minimum number of attendees for the tour to take place is 4 people

name: Essential Amsterdam Free Tour (Available in Spanish)
shortDescription:
This is the first free tour where you can choose the topics you want to know about. Select from a wide variety of topics those that interest you most. Don't you know what you want more? Don't worry, your guide will know how to give you the best tour of the city!

Everything you can't miss in Amsterdam. This tour is designed to give you a precise idea of the history of the city and, above all, so that you understand the Dutch culture and way of being . Did you know that the tulip is not Dutch? Have you ever been told that this is the country with the tallest people on the planet? What are there more bikes than inhabitants or that it was the first country in history to legalize homosexual marriage...? You will be able to respond to all this and much more after this tour.
A walk through some of the most beautiful places in the city and that, at the end, will leave you understanding the place where you pass.

The tour begins next to Dam Square. From this starting point we will talk about the topics that you choose , within our selection. The options to choose from are:

  1. origins of the city
  2. Dutch mentality: culture and revolutionary laws
  3. Why are buildings so leaning?
  4. coffee shops
  5. red light district
  6. WWII
  7. Anne Frank
  8. Provos: The Amsterdam Revolution
  9. The VOC (Dutch East India Company)
  10. Amsterdam and the lgbtiq+ collective
  11. The canals of Amsterdam
  12. the bike
  13. The tulip and the trade that dominated the planet
  14. squatting movement
  15. dutch icons


If you pass through Amsterdam you cannot miss this tour. Make the most of your experience in the city of freedom and return home with stories to tell.

* The minimum number of attendees for the tour to take place is 4 people
*We offer a theme to choose for each reservation

name: Free 3 hours Tour Amsterdam by bike (NEW) (Available in German, English, Spanish)
shortDescription:
As Amsterdam has more to offer than its a beautiful old town, we recommend you to explore and experience Amsterdam's mustsees and hidden gems by bike and of course with us.
We love to show you around Amsterdam's most beautiful and amazing spots, treasures, and surroundings with not only historical background Information, but also a lot of cool and interesting facts.
We offer from Wednesday to Sunday various tours, as there is so much and experience outside the old Center and also we don't like to do the same tour each day.
Every Wednesday

  • Amsterdam's Highlights Tour: Dam Square, Begijnhof, Vondelpark, Prinseneiland, Jordaan, Canal Belt, Anne Frankhouse and Westerchurch

Every Thursday 

  • Countryside North Tour: Waterland, Nieuwendam, Durgerdam and Amsterdam East.

Every Friday

  • Countryside South Tour: former Jewish quarter, Amstel river, Ouderkerk aan de Amstel and Amstelveen.

Every Saturday

  • Countryside North Tour: Waterland, Nieuwendam, Durgerdam and Amsterdam East.
  • Unique Amsterdam Neigborhoods Tour. Among others: Canal Belt, Jordaan, Prinseneiland, Spaarndammerbuurt, Houthavens, NDSM warf, Schoon Schip, De Ceuvel, Garden village Oostzaan, Javaeiland and the marine complex

Every Sunday

  • Amsterdam's Highlights Tour: Dam Square, Begijnhof, Vondelpark, Prinseneiland, Jordaan, Canal Belt, Anne Frankhouse and Westerchurch.

General

  • During each tour, we schedule a break of 20-30 minutes at a unique restaurant or bar (where we also would go to in our free time. So no tourist traps with us!!)
  • You can bring your own bike or you can rent one just around the corner of the Beursplein (Adress: Damrak 247). Also luggage lockers are available there
  • Depending on the weather (rain, snow, or storm) we might change the route
  • We expect everyone to be good, safe, and mature cyclists

At the end of all our bike tours, there will be enough time to give you some personal recommendations. 
There is much more we like to tell you here, but we think this should be enough to trigger you to join one or more of our bike tours !!

name: Historic Center of Amsterdam Spectacular! . Ignacio : Architect. (18+) (Available in Spanish)
description:
With the sharp eye of an Architect and guide for years , he allowed me to create a tour with a complete and entertaining vision of Amsterdam in a few hours. The tour is mainly based on: Dutch history, art, commerce, architecture, nature, science and society, from the 13th century to the 21st century.

My tour begins in the heart of Amsterdam going through all the cardinal points. We start with a review of Amsterdam and immediately start touring and tuning in what we see with the descriptive story that I will do.


∎ ∎ PLACES WE WILL VISIT AND EXPLAIN:

 ∎ Royal Palace of Amsterdam. Dam Square , History of the city.

• Courts , place of beheadings and hangings S.XVII.

• Royal Family : place of the weddings, coronations and abdications of the Dutch sovereigns. 14th-15th centuries


• Orphanage or Orphan House, from 1581.

• Former Amsterdam Central Post Office , 19th century.

• National Monument - Het Nationaal Monument.

∎ SECOND WORLD WAR : Holocaust, Anne Frank , Jews in Amsterdam: deportations, hiding places, winter of famine and the horror of the Nazi occupation.

• Houses - boats or floating houses.

∎ Slavery, Colonialism , their traces after so many centuries in the city.

∎ JEWISH QUARTER

• The Dancing Houses , an unforgettable classic.

• De nieuwe kerk XV century – New Church.

• Small, amazing houses of Amsterdam.

• Old Catholic convents , XV century.

∎ Golden Age of Holland , 17th century. Architecture, houses of the rich bourgeois with facades, unique in the world, art, science and more.

• Begijnhof Convent - XV century.

• Nieuwmark t (New Market) year 1614.

∎ ART - REMBRANDT HOUSE, baroque painter and his world. Impossible to forget. His work, his environment and his life are present on our tour in Amsterdam.

• Zuiderkerk - South Church - ( 1614)

• VOC building of the Dutch Merchant Navy - 17th century
• Exceptional wooden house from 1420 in the heart of the city.



∎ RED LIGHT LIGHT : I prepare the tourist to visit the Red Light District. with a lot of information to consider during your visit, the same for those who have already been and did not understand what they have seen. An unmissable place because Prostitution and drugs are a reality in the heart of the city. from the Middle Ages to the present day. It is the last point of the tour, on the border with the Red Light District.
 


• • MISCELLANEOUS
Unique architecture in the world, heritage channels, fossils, panoramic views to enjoy and photograph, all combined with the daily life of the Amsterdammers that will surprise us, bicycles, boats, celebrations, and endless spontaneous and surprising "Dutch" events. of daily life that will appear to us in the dynamics of the tour.
The tour ends at Niuwmarkt. For various reasons it may happen that you have to replace one place with another.

==> IMPORTANT INFORMATION: <==

1- The Municipality charges tourist tax. (Vermakelijk hedenretributie) = €1.50 Amount that is paid before starting the tour and has no relation to the value of the event itself.

2- WAITING MARGIN : it is 5-7 extra minutes for those who are late. The person who does not notify, or does not arrive after the extra minutes, can have their reservation replaced by other tourists.

3 - MINORS : The tour is not suitable for minors, since the Red Light District is part of my story and is for people with educated criteria or minors accompanied by their parents.

SUGGESTIONS
1 - Not contracting or signing up for another activity for at least one hour after the end of the tour to replenish energy and have time to get to the other activity in a relaxed way and without running into schedules

2- Check the weather forecast, wear appropriate clothing for cold or heat, sun protection, and an umbrella or raincoat, if the weather warrants it.

I wait for you, Ignacio.

name: The most complete Free Tour of Amsterdam with Baiana (Available in )
description:
Welcome to my tour of Amsterdam, our tour starts now!

Get ready to take a trip through the history of Amsterdam , to learn, impress, inspire us, and above all, have fun!
I intend to tell you what it is that makes me so in love with this city, its beauties, its curiosities, its greatest ironies and that freedom that makes it so unique.

Content :

  • Foundation of Amsterdam, a drained swamp.
  • Historical overview of the Netherlands.
  • Royal Palace and Dam Square.
  • Red Light District.
  • Dutch Golden Age.
  • VOC, East India Company
  • Boat houses.
  • Iconic churches.
  • Jewish Quarter.
  • Anna Frank
  • Rembrandt.
  • Hidden gems.
  • Dancing houses.
  • Amstel and channels.
  • Bikes.
  • Gay Pride.
  • Coin tower.
  • Floating flower market.
  • Castigatio, old jail.
  • Dutch gastronomy.
  • Coffee Shops.
  • Beguinary.
  • Architecture of the city.

Finally, we will finish at The Historical Museum of Amsterdam .

What will they take from my tour?
- An interactive virtual map with all my gastronomic recommendations in the city, which you can access whenever and wherever you want.
-Some of the most beautiful photos of Amsterdam.
-I don't want to make spoilers, but a very good surprise!
-And most importantly, a version of Amsterdam that you might never have imagined.

What should you bring?
 We will not let the Dutch rain or cold frighten us, we will fight them. It is always good to bring winter coats, raincoats, gloves and umbrellas. Please remember to check the weather before heading out.
  

Join my tour and I will be happy to show you my city!


Important information for the traveler:


* Groups larger than 4 people are not accepted on this tour. Making a reservation correctly is the responsibility of the traveler. If a group exceeds the maximum number, the guru may deny them participation in the meeting point.

* The city council of Amsterdam has imposed a Tourism Tax of € 1.50 per adult for each tourist activity carried out in the city. This must be paid before starting the tour and is independent of the collaboration for your guide.

description:

Making the reservation correctly is the responsibility of the traveler. If the group exceeds the maximum number, the reservation can be canceled at the meetingpoint.

* Attendance must be confirmed: hours before the tour you will receive a message/mail/whatsapp asking you to confirm your attendance. If they do not respond, it will be assumed that they have given up on the tour.

* Check-in is punctual, after the start time of the tour we cannot guarantee that the place will be saved.

* In Amsterdam we can go on a tour with up to 15 people. Not one more will be admitted and this includes children. If there are not enough places for your group, please do not reserve what is available.

*The tour is for people over 18 years of age.








essential amsterdam
Welcome to my tour of Amsterdam, our tour starts now!

Get ready to take a journey through the history of Amsterdam, to learn, to be impressed, to be inspired, and above all, to have fun!
In this journey I intend to address the most essential aspects of the city, those that define it: its beauties, its curiosities, its greatest ironies and that freedom that makes it so unique.

Content:

Foundation of Amsterdam, a drained swamp.
Historical overview of the Netherlands.
Royal Palace and Dam Square.
Origins of the Red Light District.
Dutch Golden Age.
VOC, East India Company
iconic churches.
Jewish Quarter.
Anna Frank
hidden gems.
Amstel and channels.
Bikes.

Dutch gastronomy.
City architecture.

Finally, we will finish the tour in front of the Amstel river, with one of the most beautiful panoramic views of the city, the Dancing Houses of Amsterdam.

What will they take from my tour?

name: Free Tour discover the Red Light District of Amsterdam in 1.5h (Available in )
description:
Get to know the vibe of the Red Light District in Amsterdam, a controversial, dark, fun neighborhood , but above all, unique in the world. On this tour we will see how the liberalism of the city is present in each of its nooks and crannies. We will talk about the history of prostitution and the origins of the Red Light District , the subsequent legalization and current regulations, the hottest live erotic shows , the nightlife, the liberal nightclubs and the Coffee Shops , which have given it worldwide fame.

Tour content:

  • History and origins of the Red Light District.
  • Legalization of prostitution.
  • Working conditions and current regulations.
  • Space, health and safety.
  • Sectorization of the Red Light District.
  • Pimping in the Netherlands.
  • Booths vs Brothels.
  • 5D porn cinema.
  • Liberal nightclubs and theme parties.
  • Oude Kerk.
  • Belle statue.
  • The historic Warmoesstraat.
  • Prostitution Information Center.
  • Mariska Major.
  • erotic sculptures.
  • Condomerie, the first store specializing in condoms.
  • Sex shops and sadomasochistic stores.


In this tour I intend to answer all your questions and curiosities. How and why is prostitution legalized in the Netherlands? What are the working conditions, safety and health of sex workers? Are they all autonomous? Who is in a situation of dependency and why? Types and values of services in the red light district of Amsterdam? Is there male sex work? Is this the only Red Light District that exists? Marijuana is legal?


Sign up for this tour to get to know the fundamentals and practice of one of the most liberal and therefore controversial neighborhoods in the world, I will be delighted to meet you!!


Important information for the traveler:

* On this tour groups larger than 4 people are not accepted.
* This tour of the Red Light District avoids walking past the sex worker booths.
* The Amsterdam City Council has imposed a Tourist Tax of €1.50 per adult for each tourist activity carried out in the city. This must be paid before starting the tour and is independent of the collaboration for your guide.

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Free Tour of the Jewish Quarter, WWII & the Anne Frank Story (Available in English)
description:
Why was Amsterdam the safest place for Jews to live for 350 years until WWII, when it became the country with the highest percentage (75%) of Jews deported to the death camps in Western Europe? The best chance to survive was to go into hiding, just as Anne Frank and her family did in 1942.  

We will use Anne Frank’s story to understand what it was like to live in a country occupied by a Nazi regime for both Jews and non-Jews,

And we will talk about the incredible exploits of the heroes and traitors during the war, both Jewish and Christian. 

  • The brothers who stole millions from the Dutch National Bank to support the resistance.
  • The Jewish sisters who provided a haven to many other Jews, were deported as criminals, and took care of Anne and Margot Frank in Auschwitz and Bergen-Belsen.
  • The paid informants who hunted down Jews in hiding, including the Jewish woman who betrayed seven hundred Jews.
  • The effects of Queen Wilhelmina's anti-semitism on the fates of Dutch Jews


We will also discuss the kinds of lies used to create such virulent anti-Semitism and how lies continue to be used today to foment hate and war.


The tour will take place in the Jewish Quarter, the heart of Jewish culture in Amsterdam.  We will begin inside the glass doors of the Stadsloket across from the Spinoza Monument on Waterlooplein.  I have long white hair, black glasses and a GuruWalk badge. The tour will go on unless there are hurricane warnings.

If participants want general information on Amsterdam, that will also be included in the tour.

Our tour will start at the Spinoza Monument and visit: 

  • The Jewish Resistance Monument
  • The Jewish Boys Orphanage
  • The Shadow Wall
  • The National Holocaust Names Monument
  • The Memorial to the Deaf Students
  • The Dutch Theater (the deportation center in Amsterdam)
  • The Artis Zoo
  • The Auschwitz Monument
  • The Portuguese Synagogue & The Jewish Museum


We will arrive at the Portuguese Synagogue two hours and 15 minutes after the beginning of the tour. The tour will be completely over within two and a half hours.

 

All your questions and comments are welcome and will serve to make the tour come alive for everybody.  Since we are in Amsterdam, we will try to make even this tour about WWII as gezellig (friendly and convivial) as possible.

PLEASE PERSONALLY CONFIRM WITH ME THAT YOU WILL ATTEND THE TOUR A DAY AHEAD.  I will send you a reminder email. Tours in Amsterdam are limited to 15 persons, so an accurate count is necessary.

It is a good idea to have WhatsApp on the mobile number you gave to Guruwalk while in Europe in order to communicate easily. Downloading the Guruwalk app will also make sure you receive terrific tips about Amsterdam after the tour and ensure that you don't miss any messages.

Note:  This tour does not go to the Anne Frank House, which is a 25-minute walk from the end of our tour. 

This tour is a terrific accompaniment or substitute for the Anne Frank House (annefrank.org). You can only buy tickets to the Anne Frank House through their website. Read this two months early and follow the directions closely!. Book the terrific introductory program in English if it is available. https://www.annefrank.org/en/museum/tickets/


The Van Gogh Museum and Rijksmuseum are usually sold out for at least a week.  Reserve early for many museums.

If you will visit at least three Dutch museums (including the Anne Frank House and the Portuguese Synagogue), it can be a good idea to buy a Museum Card for 65 euros, good at 450 museums for one year. You can buy a temporary pass at the first museum you visit, use that pass five times, and receive a permanent pass within five days or less.  If ordering tickets for the Anne Frank House or other museum, check that you have a Museum Card and don't pay anything online.  Then buy the card at the first museum you visit. https://www.museum.nl/en/museumpass

We pass by The Resistance Museum on our tour. That is a terrific source for more detailed WWII stories. No reservations needed and not so expensive: https://www.verzetsmuseum.org/en 


I look forward to seeing you soon, Jon

name: Historic Center Free Walking Tour of Amsterdam (Available in Spanish)
description:
On this visit you will enjoy getting to know the history, culture and everyday life of the Dutch while strolling through the main streets of the city center. Whether it is your first trip to Amsterdam or you already know it, we assure you that these will be the best 3 hours of your stay! Our Spanish-speaking guides accompany you on this free tour that will provide you with an overview of the city and from which you can get many ideas to make the most of your trip;) During the tour we will see all the essential points of this unique city and we will reveal some of the secrets it contains. This is our itinerary: - We will start in front of Amsterdam Central Station. - We will pass through Dam Square and its monuments: The Royal Palace, the New Church and the National Monument. - We will tell you that it is cooked inside the Red Light District. - We will see the colorful Chinatown and the Buddhist temple. - We will travel back in time with the stories of the Jewish Quarter and Rembrandt's house. - We will shop at the famous Waterloo market and cross the canals that inspired Monet. - We will finish at the Flower Market surrounded by tulips. https://youtu.be/_l4H34WEA14

name: The Essential Amsterdam Walking Tour (ENGLISH +18) (Available in English)
description:
A tour for culture and history lovers, with a good mix of story-telling, sightseeing, curious facts and tailor made recommendations for all kinds of travelers! 

As we go for a pleasant walk through hidden alleys, at each step lifting the veil of its unseen memory, we get intimate with this fantastic city, and by the end of our tour, you will really understand what shaped this place and it's people.

  • Origins of Amsterdam and the Netherlands
  • Oude Kerk & The Redlight District
  • Chinatown
  • Nieuwe Market and the Old City Gates
  • VOC Headquarters (Dutch East India Company)
  • Dutch golden age and Independence
  • Jewish Quarter, WW2 and the Hunger Winter
  • The houses of Amsterdam and their unique architecture
  • Drugs & and crime in Amsterdam
  • Modern Dutch culture 
     


Keep in mind that there is a limit of 15 people max per group, imposed by the municipality of Amsterdam. Therefore, bringing more people than you booked might not be possible. 

The tours is for individuals and small groups of up to 4 persons. Bigger groups can contact us for a private tour. We reserve the right to turn away multiple reservations resulting in groups bigger than 4 people. This includes different members of the same group attempting to join the tour by making several individual bookings. (exceptions can be made for families with kids) 


All travelers are required to arrive at the meeting point at least 10  minutes earlier. After the tour starts, mobile communication with the guide will be scarce, as the group has his full attention

name: Free tour Amsterdam (Available in Spanish)
description:
Amsterdam is a magical city also known as the Venice of the North, due to all the channels that cross it.

 We will start our free tour at the Royal Palace, where we will tell you how this small fishing town became one of the greatest powers of maritime commerce in the XVI - XVII centuries. 

We will visit the Oudekerk, which is the oldest church in the city, taking advantage of its location in the Red Light District to reveal the history of this curious and popular Amsterdam neighborhood.

 We will discover the remains of the wall of De Waag and explain the most macabre face of this city. We will explain the mark marked by French and Spanish while enjoying their famous channels. 

We will also remember the Nazi occupation and resistance of the Amsterdamers. There will be time to go through its beautiful flower market, located where once a religious order existed, already disappeared.

 Duration of the free tour: 2 hours and a half 

What are you going to visit?
 Dam Square City History Oude Kerk (Old Church) Nieuwmarkt Square and Market Waag Traditional Architecture Begijnhofkapel Religious Complex Amsterdam City Museum Royal Palace Nieuwe Kerk (New Church) 

White Umbrella Tours guarantees an excellent service for our clients. 

Recommendations: At the meeting point there are usually guides from other agencies, we recommend that you look for our white umbrellas, since otherwise, we will not be able to guarantee our quality.


Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end

name: Authentic Free Walking Tour: Jordaan, Anna Frank and Voldenpark (Available in Spanish)
description:
As if we were getting into a time machine, the authentic Amsterdam tour will transport you to the past to know in detail how the Dutch lived in their young days. We can not forget the present, and therefore, we will see together what is going on in this city today! This will be a 360 vision of all that has happened in this emblematic city!!

name: The #1 Best Rated Walking Tour in Amsterdam (Available in English)
description:
Discover the fascinating history of the most liberal city in the world with FreeDam Tours – the best-rated walking tour in Amsterdam! Together with your super-local guide, you will discover how freedom and tolerance shaped the city and its people throughout the ages and understand how these values continue to influence it today.

We combine beautiful sightseeing with exciting storytelling and cover everything you need to know about Amsterdam in one tour: history, modern life, culture, art, fun facts and personal stories for a unique insider’s perspective on life in Amsterdam. Be prepared to challenge all your pre-conceived ideas about this city because after this tour you will never look and think of Amsterdam the same way.

“From the Red Light District to the evolution of Amsterdam as the global centre of world trade in the 17th century, its transition from a republic to a monarchy, the tragedy of the Nazi occupation and its enlightened and effective attitude to drug control, your guide will stitch these diverse items together with humorous personal anecdotes and insightful commentary on the underlying social and cultural mores of the Dutch people”.

Useful information:
+ Small Groups of Maximum 15 people for a truly high-quality experience and access to areas that are off-limits to other walking tours.
+ Supported by pictures painting and maps that bring history to life.
+ Super Local Guides: all our guides are life-long locals with very deep roots in this city, country and culture so they can answer any question you may have.
+ Free Snack & Souvenir: on the tour, you will be treated to a typical Dutch snack and you will also receive a nice souvenir in the end.

Duration: 2.5 hours
Starting point: Stock exchange
Endpoint: Dam Square

name: Anne Frank's Amsterdam: what you've never been told (Available in )
description:
On this virtual tour of the beautiful Prince's Canal in the center of Amsterdam, I invite you to learn a little more about the history of Anne Frank. We will surround the area where the secret attic was located in which Ana, along with her family, hid for just over two years to escape German persecution. On our walk, we will also discover the history of the Westerkerk , the most imposing church in Amsterdam, we will walk next to the house where the famous philosopher René Descartes lived and we will enjoy one of the most charming neighborhoods of the Dutch capital, the neighborhood of the Jordaan .

Discover with me in this virtual tour the stories that make Anne Frank a perfect representative of the spirit of tolerance and freedom that characterizes Amsterdam.

description:

name: The Free tour of Amsterdam for the curious (Available in )
description:
Welcome to Amsterdam!
 On this tour we will see and learn how this city has been formed based on its history, architecture, commerce and the character of its inhabitants.

We'll start at Dam Square , where we'll take a journey back in time to Amsterdam's beginnings in the 9th century, to its golden days in the 17th century. Right there we will see three of its famous monuments. We will stroll through the most famous streets of the center (and other lesser known ones), where I will explain curiosities and key historical facts that have marked Dutch society, such as the Second World War , the Protestant religion or its expansion and trade in the New World .

Places and essential points that we will see and talk about:

  • Royal Palace - Het Koninklijk Paleis
  • New Church - De nieuwe Kerk.
  • National Monument - Het Nationaal Monument
  • The old Stock Exchange building - Beurs van Berlage
  • amstel river
  • Courtyard of the Beguines – Begijnhof (temporarily closed)
  • singel channel
  • De Krijtberg
  • Flower Market – Bloemenmarkt
  • Coin Tower - Munttoren  
  • Canals, bridges and their curiosities
  • old jewish quarter
  • Rembrandt House
  • Niuwemarkt and De Waag (Chinatown)



In addition to advice and resolution of doubts that you have about the day to day of the city, where to eat, drink, buy or museums to visit. We will have time to stop at each site to take photos (I always carry my camera with me, I love photography), and at several points there are benches in case someone needs to rest for a couple of minutes while I tell you curiosities.

SUGGESTION : comfortable shoes and clothes, umbrella or raincoat (you never know) and desire to discover the old town of Amsterdam.

* The route may undergo some modification due to works, crowds or unforeseen events in general.
**The tourist tax of €1.5 required by the Municipality will be requested at the beginning of the tour.

name: Free Tour of Amsterdam's City Centre  (Available in English)
description:
Experience one of Europe's most beautifully preserved historical city centers on this walking tour which delves into the history, culture, and architecture of a truly unique place. Hear about how a damp swamp was transformed into a global melting pot and how the experience of the Second World War triggered a revolution in social experimentation that continues to unfold today.
Highlights include: 

  • How the first inhabitants fought with the elements to create their own land 
  • The social experiment of legalized prostitution and the controversial changes to the Red Light District 
  • The revolutionary principles of the Dutch East India Company
  • The battle of building on a swamp and the uniqueness of the city's architecture 
  • Coffeeshops and the Netherlands' policy on soft drugs
  • How a post-war housing crisis triggered a radical experiment in communal living 


From the square where the original inhabitants laid a dam, the headquarters of the Dutch East India Company, the Amstel River and its beautiful houseboats, the UNESCO World Heritage Site that is the canal belt, and the bells of the Western Church that Anne Frank wrote about in her diary you will experience the highlights and hidden gems of a world-famous city. 

Please note that due to strict regulations on tour group sizes in Amsterdam this tour is designed for individuals and small groups up to a maximum of 6 people. Larger groups can contact me for a private tour. A group of larger than 6 which has booked under multiple reservations will not be permitted to join. 

Free tour: Book for free and pay what you want at the end
